guide.title: User Guide
guide.subtitle: Everything you need to know about The Q

questions.createFirstCode: How do I create my first QR code?
questions.createFirstCodeAnswer: Go to the Dashboard and click "Create New Experience". Upload an image, video, PDF or choose another content type - and the code will be created automatically! The code is dynamic, meaning you can change its content anytime.
questions.uploadMediaAnswer: Drag a file to the upload area or click "+" to add content. Supports images (JPG, PNG, WebP, GIF), video (MP4, WebM) and PDF. Maximum size: 5MB per file.
questions.shareCode: How do I share the code?
questions.shareCodeAnswer: Click the share icon on the code card. You can copy the link, download the QR code as an image for printing, or open in a new window for preview.
questions.whatIsDynamicAnswer: A dynamic code is a QR code whose content can be changed anytime - without printing a new code! Print once, update content whenever you want through the Dashboard.
questions.imageVsGallery: What's the difference between an image and a gallery?
questions.imageVsGalleryAnswer: A single image displays only that image. If you upload multiple images to the same code, they appear as a swipeable gallery. You can also enable "Selfie Gallery" that allows viewers to upload their own photos.
questions.pdfAnimation: How do I upload a PDF with animation?
questions.pdfAnimationAnswer: Simply upload a PDF file! The system will automatically display it with a 3D page flip animation. Click the gear icon inside the media card to customize settings: flip direction, single/double page mode, sounds, download, and more.
questions.whatIsRiddleAnswer: An interactive landing page with custom design. You can add a title, styled text (bold, italic, headers), images, YouTube video, and even allow viewers to upload selfies to a shared gallery.
questions.whatIsSelfiebeamAnswer: A selfie wall for events! Like Riddle, but focused on photo uploads. You can add a company logo that will appear cyclically in the gallery between participant photos. Perfect for corporate events and parties.
questions.createWeeklyCalAnswer: Select "Q.Cal" from the create experience menu. You can define weeks, time slots, events with images and links, and even enable registration (RSVP) for activities. Perfect for hotels, camps, and activity venues.
questions.qrSignLogo: How do I add a logo to the center of the QR code?
questions.qrSignLogoAnswer: Click the "QR Sign" button on the code card. Select "Logo" and upload an image (PNG with transparent background works best). You can change size and background color. The logo will appear in the center of the code even when downloaded for printing.
questions.qrSignText: How do I add text to the center of the QR code?
questions.qrSignTextAnswer: In "QR Sign" settings select "Text". You can enter up to 4 characters (numbers, letters, or symbols). Customize text color and background color to match your design.
questions.qrSignEmoji: How do I add an emoji to the center of the QR code?
questions.qrSignEmojiAnswer: In "QR Sign" settings select "Emoji" or "Icon". You can choose from hundreds of built-in icons or paste an emoji of your choice.
questions.qrColors: Can I change the QR code color?
questions.qrColorsAnswer: Currently the code itself stays black and white to ensure maximum scan reliability. However, you can customize the sign colors in the center of the code - both the symbol and background colors.
questions.printSafe: Is the code safe for printing?
questions.printSafeAnswer: Yes! Our codes are designed for printing. Click "Download QR Code" to get a high-quality image. Tip: Print at least 2x2 cm for easy scanning.
questions.whatsappWidget: How do I add a WhatsApp button?
questions.whatsappWidgetAnswer: Click "Widgets" then WhatsApp. Choose between "Phone Number" (for private chat) or "Group" (group link). You can add a pre-filled message that will appear automatically.
questions.whatsappGroup: How do I connect to a WhatsApp group?
questions.whatsappGroupAnswer: In the WhatsApp widget select "Group" and paste the join link. How to get the link? Open the group → Group settings → Invite via link → Copy link.
questions.phoneWidget: How do I add a call button?
questions.phoneWidgetAnswer: In the Widgets menu select "Phone". Enter an Israeli or international phone number. Scanners can dial directly with one tap.
questions.emailWidget: How do I add an email button?
questions.emailWidgetAnswer: In the Widgets menu select "Email". Enter an email address, and optionally - a pre-filled subject and body. Scanners can send an email with one tap.
questions.navigationWidget: How do I add a navigation button?
questions.navigationWidgetAnswer: In the Widgets menu select "Navigation". Enter an address or place name, and choose an app (Waze or Google Maps). Scanners will be directed straight to navigation.
questions.smsWidget: How do I add an SMS button?
questions.smsWidgetAnswer: In the Widgets menu select "SMS". Enter a phone number and pre-filled message. Scanners can send a message with one tap.
questions.openVoting: How do I open a Q.Vote voting?
questions.openVotingAnswer: Create a new code and select "Q.Vote". Configure the voting phases, add candidates (manually or bulk upload), and customize the design. When ready, move to the "Voting" phase.
questions.votingPhases: What are the different voting phases?
questions.votingPhasesAnswer:
1. Registration - candidates register (optional)
2. Preparation - organize candidates before opening
3. Voting - voting is open
4. Finals - additional round for leaders (optional)
5. Calculating - processing results
6. Results - displaying winners
questions.addCandidatesAnswer: In voting editor click "Add Candidate". You can add manually (name + photo) or upload an Excel file with many candidates at once. You can also allow self-registration of candidates.
questions.shuffleCandidates: How do I shuffle candidate order?
questions.shuffleCandidatesAnswer: In voting settings enable "Shuffle Candidates". Each scanner will see candidates in a different random order - prevents bias based on list position.
questions.limitVotes: How do I limit the number of votes?
questions.limitVotesAnswer: In settings you can set: minimum selections (e.g., must choose at least 2), maximum selections (up to 3), and how many times a vote can be changed.
questions.showResultsAnswer: Move to the "Results" phase. You can display as an animated flipbook (exciting countdown!) or regular view. You can also hide results from voters until you choose to reveal.
questions.whatIsQstageAnswer: Q.Stage is a live audience voting system for talent shows, debates, and competitions. The audience votes in real-time (like/dislike), and a dramatic vertical bar displays the approval percentage - just like TV talent shows!
questions.startVotingSession: How do I start a voting session?
questions.startVotingSessionAnswer: Create a Q.Stage code and configure settings. In "Standby" mode, display the screen to the audience. When ready, move to "Countdown" (3, 2, 1...) and then "Voting" opens automatically.
questions.qstagePhasesAnswer:
1. Standby - waiting screen before voting
2. Countdown - dramatic countdown (3, 2, 1...)
3. Voting - audience votes live
4. Results - final percentage displayed with celebratory effect if threshold passed
questions.addJudgesAnswer: In Q.Stage settings, enable judges and add them with names. Each judge receives a unique link with higher vote weight (e.g., 5x). Judges can vote after the audience closes or during.
questions.customizeDisplay: How do I customize the display screen?
questions.customizeDisplayAnswer: In display settings you can set: background (color/image/video), bar position (left/right), voter grid visibility, sounds, and whether to show vote counts. Perfect for projecting at events.
questions.qstageThresholdsAnswer: Thresholds define color changes as the bar fills up. Default: red at low, orange building up, yellow at halfway, green for success. You can customize colors and the success percentage (default 65%).
questions.whatIsQhuntAnswer: Q.Hunt is a competitive QR code scanning race! Scatter multiple codes around a venue, and teams compete to scan as many as possible. Perfect for team building events, exhibitions, and corporate activities.
questions.createHuntCodes: How do I create hunt codes?
questions.createHuntCodesAnswer: Create a folder and enable "Hunt Mode" in folder settings. Add multiple codes to the folder - each will be a station in the hunt. Print the codes and scatter them around your venue.
questions.teamScoringAnswer: When a team scans a code, they earn points. You can assign different point values to different codes. The team with the most points wins! Set time limits for extra excitement.
questions.huntLeaderboardAnswer: Yes! The hunt has a real-time leaderboard that updates as teams scan codes. Display it on a big screen at your event to boost the competitive spirit.
questions.whatIsQtreasureAnswer: Q.Treasure is a sequential treasure hunt experience! Participants follow a series of stations, each with clues leading to the next. Add videos, riddles, and challenges at each stop.
questions.createTreasureStations: How do I create treasure hunt stations?
questions.createTreasureStationsAnswer: Create a folder with "Treasure Hunt" mode. Add codes in order - each becomes a station. The first station is the starting point, and each subsequent station reveals after scanning the previous one.
questions.addCluesAndVideos: Can I add clues and videos?
questions.addCluesAndVideosAnswer: Absolutely! Each station can include: text clues, images, YouTube videos, riddles to solve, and more. Make it as simple or elaborate as you want.
questions.treasureProgressAnswer: Participants see their progress through the hunt - how many stations they've completed and what's next. You can add a final celebration screen when they complete all stations.
questions.qvoteBranding: How do I customize Q.Vote branding?
questions.qvoteBrandingAnswer: In Q.Vote settings, go to the "Branding" tab. You can set: logo, background image/color, primary colors, custom titles, and button styles. Make the voting experience match your event's look.
questions.disableLandingPage: How do I disable the landing page?
questions.disableLandingPageAnswer: In Q.Vote settings, toggle off "Show Landing Page". Voters will go directly to the voting screen instead of seeing a welcome page first. Useful for quick voting scenarios.
questions.requireRegistrationAnswer: Yes! Enable "Require Registration" in settings. Voters will need to enter their name/details before voting. You can also require phone verification to prevent duplicate votes.
questions.changeColors: How do I change experience colors?
questions.changeColorsAnswer: In experience editing (Riddle, Q.Vote, Q.Cal) there are design options: background color, text color, button colors. Choose from ready colors or enter a custom color.
questions.setupLandingPage: What is a landing page and how do I set it up?
questions.setupLandingPageAnswer: A landing page appears when there are multiple media items in a code. It shows buttons to choose from. Click "Landing Page" on the code card to customize: background, colors, titles, and button style.
questions.customButtons: How do I customize landing page buttons?
questions.customButtonsAnswer: In landing page settings you can choose style (solid, outline, glass), layout (list or grid), and colors. You can also give custom names to each button instead of default names.
questions.mediaLinkButton: How do I add a link button on an image?
questions.mediaLinkButtonAnswer: Click an image in the code and select "Media Link". Enter a URL and button name. When the viewer clicks the image, a button will appear leading to the link.
questions.createFolder: How do I create a folder/library?
questions.createFolderAnswer: Click "New Library" in the Dashboard. Name the library and drag codes into it. Libraries help organize codes by project, event, or client.
questions.moveToFolder: How do I move a code to a folder?
questions.moveToFolderAnswer: Simply drag the code card and drop it on the desired folder. You can also move a code back to the main dashboard.
questions.duplicateCode: How do I duplicate a code?
questions.duplicateCodeAnswer: Click the three dots on the code card and select "Duplicate". A new copy will be created with a new QR code, but with the same content. Useful for creating variations.
questions.transferOwnership: How do I transfer code ownership?
questions.transferOwnershipAnswer: Admins can click "Transfer Ownership" in the code menu, search for a user, and transfer. The code will completely move to the other user's account.
questions.scheduleMedia: How do I schedule media to appear on specific dates?
questions.scheduleMediaAnswer: Click the clock icon on the media card. Set start and end dates, and optionally - daily active hours. The media will only appear at the times you've set.
questions.autoReplace: How do I do automatic media replacement?
questions.autoReplaceAnswer: When replacing a file, choose "Schedule Replacement" instead of "Replace Now". Select a date and time - and the file will be replaced automatically at the time you set. Perfect for changing menus or scheduled messages.
questions.activityScheduleAnswer: In the weekly calendar and other experiences, you can set when each item appears. For example: breakfast from 7:00 to 10:00, lunch from 12:00 to 15:00.
questions.viewStats: Where can I see how many views a code has?
questions.viewStatsAnswer:
Two options:
1. In Dashboard - view count appears on each code card
2. In Analytics - click "Analytics" in the menu for detailed statistics
questions.viewSource: How do I know where views came from?
questions.viewSourceAnswer: In the Analytics page you'll see breakdown by device type (mobile, desktop, tablet), views by hour of day, and views by date. Choose a date range for focused analysis.
questions.clickReportAnswer: A click report shows how many times links in your content were clicked - links in images, PDF buttons, and widgets. Helps understand what interests viewers most.
questions.whatIsXPAnswer:
A point system for gamification! Viewers earn XP for actions:
• 10 XP - scanning a new code
• 25 XP - uploading a photo to gallery
• 50 XP - completing a route
The more XP earned, the higher the level and more prizes received.
questions.setupPrizes: How do I set up prizes?
questions.setupPrizesAnswer: In library (Route) settings enable "Prize System". Add prizes with name, image, rarity (common/rare/epic/legendary) and stock quantity. The system will distribute prizes automatically based on odds.
questions.whatIsRouteAnswer: A route turns a regular library into a gamification experience. Viewers scan codes along the route, earn XP, and receive prizes. Perfect for museums, exhibitions, and puzzle trails.
questions.howLobbyWorks: How does the lobby screen work?
questions.howLobbyWorksAnswer: The lobby screen displays winners in real-time on a large screen. When someone wins a rare/epic/legendary prize, their name and prize appear on screen. Address: /lobby/[route-id]
questions.shareLink: How do I share a code link?
questions.shareLinkAnswer: Click the share icon on the code card. The link will be copied to clipboard. You can also click "Open in new window" for preview.
questions.downloadQR: How do I download the QR code for printing?
questions.downloadQRAnswer: Click "Download QR Code" on the code card. The image will download in high quality, ready for printing. If you set up a QR Sign (logo/text), it will appear in the image.
questions.publicUrlsAnswer:
• /v/[short-code] - main code view
• /gallery/[short-code] - photo gallery
• /lobby/[route-id] - lobby screen for prizes
• /packs/[route-id] - pack opening
questions.galleryUrl: How do I get a link to only the photo gallery?
questions.galleryUrlAnswer: The gallery is accessible at /gallery/[short-code]. Useful for display on a large screen at events. In the gallery you can hide the header by pressing and releasing Ctrl.
questions.keyboardShortcutsAnswer:
• Ctrl/Cmd + release in gallery - show/hide header (code owner only)
• Escape - close popup windows
• Drag and drop - move codes between folders
questions.mobilePreview: How do I see a mobile preview?
questions.mobilePreviewAnswer: Click "Mobile Preview" on the code card. A window will open simulating how the code looks on a phone - perfect for testing before distribution.
questions.collaborators: Can I give others access to a code?
questions.collaboratorsAnswer: Currently a code belongs to one user. You can transfer ownership completely, or share login credentials (not recommended). Sharing feature in future development.
questions.globalCodesAnswer: A global code is visible to all users in the system (not just the owner). Only system admins can mark a code as global. Useful for examples and tutorials.
questions.imagePositioning: How do I make sure images look good on all devices?
questions.imagePositioningAnswer: When uploading images (landing image, candidates, categories), click the position button to adjust the image. The tool allows dragging and zooming to choose which part of the image will be displayed. You can switch between device previews (mobile, tablet, kiosk) to see how the image will look on each.
questions.imageSafeZone: What is the "safe zone" in images?
questions.imageSafeZoneAnswer: The safe zone is the central part of the image that is guaranteed to be visible on all devices. Important content like logos, text, or faces should be placed in this area. In the positioning tool, the safe zone is marked with a dashed green border, and areas that may be cropped are darkened.

terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.whatIsQueueDesc: Queue is a dynamic QR code system that allows you to change the content behind the code at any time, schedule experiences, and view usage data in real time.
terms.alphaVersionDesc: The system is currently in alpha version. This means the system may change from time to time, features may be added or modified, and there may be bugs or unexpected changes.
terms.contentResponsibilityDesc: Users are solely responsible for all content they upload to the system. Do not upload offensive, illegal content, or content that infringes copyrights.
terms.serviceRights: The service reserves the right to remove inappropriate content and block users who violate the terms of use.
terms.privacyDesc: The system collects anonymous usage data to improve the service and display analytics to users. We do not share personal information with third parties.
terms.liabilityDesc: The service is provided "as is" without warranty of any kind. We are not responsible for direct or indirect damages arising from use of the service.
terms.termsChangesDesc: We reserve the right to update these terms from time to time. Continued use of the service constitutes agreement to the updated terms.

items.question: What is a dynamic QR code?
items.answer: A dynamic QR code allows you to change the content behind it at any time, without printing a new code. Print once, update forever.

items.question: Can I use it for free?
items.answer: Yes! The free plan includes one QR code with 25MB storage. Perfect for getting started.

items.question: How do I know who scanned my code?
items.answer: Our analytics system shows real-time data: view counts, device types, peak hours and more - without collecting personal information.

items.question: What's the difference between subscription and one-time event?
items.answer: A subscription is ideal for ongoing use. One-time events are perfect for those who need the system for a specific event (like voting or selfie wall) for a limited period.

items.question: Are there ads on my content?
items.answer: No! All plans (including free) are ad-free. The free plan only shows a small The Q logo.

items.question: How does the Q.Vote voting system work?
items.answer: Q.Vote is a complete voting system featuring: participant registration, voting phases (regular + finals), animated results display, and detailed statistics.

items.question: What is Selfiebeam?
items.answer: A digital selfie wall for events. Guests take selfies from their phones, and photos appear on a big screen in a shared gallery.

items.question: Can I combine multiple experiences in one code?
items.answer: Absolutely! You can add multiple media items to the same code and schedule each one separately. For example: breakfast menu in the morning and dinner menu in the evening.

security.title: Fair and Secure Voting
security.subtitle: Perfect for competitions with prizes - prevents multiple votes and fraud

levels.description: Code sent to phone - number locked from voting again

items.question: How many participants can I add?
items.answer: No limit! The system works for events from 20 to 2000+ participants.

items.question: Do I need an app?
items.answer: No! Everything works through the phone browser - scan QR and start immediately.

items.question: How do you prevent duplicate votes?
items.answer: WhatsApp/SMS verification - code is sent to phone and locks the number from voting again.

items.question: Can I limit who can vote?
items.answer: Yes! You can set an approved numbers list (whitelist) - only they can vote.

items.question: Can I display on a big screen?
items.answer: Absolutely! There are projection-ready displays with real-time updates.

items.question: What if there's a technical issue during the event?
items.answer: We're available on WhatsApp throughout the event for immediate support.

items.question: How long does setup take?
items.answer: Basic setup - one business day. With full branding - 2-3 days.

items.question: Do you rent equipment?
items.answer: Yes! We offer tablet and stand rentals for your event.

items.question: I have multiple branches - how does it work?
items.answer: You can open multiple voting instances for different branches, or create groups within one voting and let everyone vote for everyone. You can even run a competition between branches - not just individual!

items.question: What internet do I need at the event?
items.answer: Participants upload and vote using their cellular data - just make sure there's good coverage at the venue. The display computer needs a separate, stable network - wired is recommended, but dedicated WiFi works great too.

items.question: How many candidates can I upload?
items.answer: You can upload dozens (or even hundreds) of candidates, then select which ones appear in the voting interface. This way you control exactly who competes.
